attributes.action: force the Banks to pass on the Bank of England base rate cuts to lenders.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Over the last 12 months the Bank of England has cut the base rate by 2%, (0.25% Feb 08, 0.25% Apr 08, and 0.5% Oct 08).

Banks have reduced the amount paid out to savings customers after the Bank of England's base rate cuts, but have not cut monthly payments for borrowers.

Banks are profiteering at the expense of customers just as they always have done. They are building up their own profit margins at the expense of savers and home owners.

The consumer deserves a break, the failure to pass on rate cuts to lenders will hamper the government's attempts to stabilise the economy, as well as cause home owners to lose their homes, at a time when belts are tightening, jobs are under threat and our taxes are shoring up the banks due to there failed strategies.

It it time for the Banks to play fair!
